186031723.review: These streets ain't what they used to be, but Cole is still the man.

186025631.review: Tope de gama de Rockstar. Uno vive su vida jugando juegos y se da cuenta cuando una historia tiene humanidad cuando lo que se esta contando tiene ALMA. Uno siempre es Cole Phelps , lo compre por todos los guiños al cine noir y aunque estuviesen presentes me quedaron en segundo plano con todo lo que te ofrece el juego. Hoy te cobran 60USD para jugar una historia que no te hace sentir nada.

185994164.review: This is so cool I wish Los Angeles was real

185986998.review: Feels like a time trip into the post-war era.

185983329.review:
Great detective game. I would love a sequel or a UHD remaster.

Story 9/10
Replayability 7/10
Graphics 7/10 (in 2011 it was probably an 8 or 9)
Animations /10 (the game is story driven but the driving is pretty awful. The other animations are good)

185976185.review:
Plusy:
+ niezła fabuła, czerpiąca z klasycznych filmów noir
+ dobrze napisane postacie
+ klimat Los Angeles lat 40.
+ różnorodne i ciekawe sprawy do rozwiązania
+ muzyka

Minusy:
- Mocno "drewniany" model strzelania
- Takie sobie prowadzenie pojazdów
- Model przesłuchiwania świadków, choć ciekawie zaprojektowany i wykorzystujący imponującą technologię, bywa irytująco wymagający i nieintuicyjny (zwłaszcza gdy dążysz do najlepszego wyniku za sprawę)
- brak aktywności pobocznych w otartym świecie (był on w ogóle potrzebny?)

Ogólnie:
Solidna przygodówka, choć niektóre mechaniki mogłyby być lepiej zaprojektowane.

185971654.review:
Cooles Game hab ich so nicht erwartet. Man kann sag ich mal relativ realitätsnahe Polizeiarbeit machen und es macht echt laune Fälle zu bearbeiten von Untersuchung des Tatorts und gegebenenfalls der Leiche bis zur Verhaftung und Befragung der Verdächtigen bis der Fall eben abgeschlossen ist.

Es gibt die 5 Großen Bereiche Streifenpolizist, Verkehrsdezernat, Mordkomission, die Sitte und Brandfälle

185953369.review:
A very good investigative game with original mechanisms and a great story set in 1940s Los Angeles as a police investigator who rises to the top but also falls to the bottom of his career.
Although as the game is old and It crashed a couple of times while running, so I was captivated and had fun...
I recommend it to anyone who likes detective games or noir movies.

185950190.review: 玩法和剧情都很优秀的游戏。面补和质询机制是这游戏的玩法核心，但是游戏本身也受到了这个机制的制约，但不妨碍是个好游戏。剧情很优秀，演出效果也很不错，几个主要角色塑造得很不错，有血有肉，棱角分明，但看得出来中间删减过内容，菲尔普斯的黑化使游戏的主线转变衔接有点突兀。可惜这么多年了也没有续作。

185943210.review: This great game has flaws, but fully compensating them with atmosphere and good story. 8 of 10 from me.

185922659.review: Finding a game such as this is like chasing shadows, you never know what you're gonna get. But this is by far one of the most immersive games I have ever played. They seamlessly mix different types of gameplay for a wonderfully varied experience. 10/10, would reccomend.

185905548.review:
Really felt like I was in 1940's L.A. Solving the crimes was fun and always interesting. The story line built up to a really enjoyable last third. 

I felt like some of the task began to be to repetitive, like when the crime in process popped up... and it was all the way across town.... like really far.

185904553.review:
A low quality Rockstar game. The first chapter is boring. The second chapter is excellent. The third and fourth chapters are just meh. Many poor design choices. Only worth buying on discounted offer.

Non US version changes the Good Cop / Bad Cop / Lie feature - instead its Truth, Doubt or Lie which is very confusing to start.

The last 2 chapters are full of bugs when finding clues. I wasted many intuition points trying to trouble shoot poor clue finding.

I expected a better product from Rockstar games.

5.5 out of 10. Worth a play, but nothing special.

185892805.review: It's a very good detective game. Love the atmosphere...

185879186.review: one of my top 3 ever. im obsessed

185879059.review: One of the best expression facial game I ever experience specially from a 2011 masterpiece, there's also a hidden scene after the credits spoiler alert last mission main character dies thank you rockstar.

185832641.review:
Gunplay is wack and honestly the most annoying part of this game. Luckily they're few and far between, but IMO there's still too many.

Beyond that? You should 100% this game. Be sure to find every clue and explore every corner. This game rules.

185826115.review: Auflösungen gibt hier es nur für Bildschirme aus dem Kalten Krieg, schwach.

185806848.review: This game was way ahead of its time.

185744516.review:
Juego de culto que revolucionó la industria.
Los gráficos se notan algo anticuados (de la época a partir del 2010), pero en general la ambientación es soberbia (la Los Ángeles de los años 40 es recreada con maestría). 
Hay dos cosas que este juego hace de forma excelente: la historia y la captura de movimientos faciales (estas últimas sorprenden incluso a día de hoy).
La historia tipo cine Noire está muy bien escrita y las actuaciones son muy buenas. Habrá que recoger pistas, perseguir a sospechosos, ir en coche e interrogar a gente libreta en mano. 
En los interrogatorios, deberás fijarte bien en las muecas y las expresiones faciales de las personas para acusar luego (o no). 
Si la puntuación no es la deseada, se pueden repetir los episodios.
Eso sí, el juego no es perfecto, ya que el mundo abierto presentado aquí es extremadamente plano y con pocas tareas por hacer. El combate cuerpo a cuerpo es tosco y funciona un poco regular.

Así que, en el sentido más literal de la palabra: este juego ES CINE...

185715645.review:
[h2]Українська[/h2]
L.A. Noire — одна з небагатьох ігор, яка змушує гравця не розробляти стратегію, а аналізувати. Ви вивчаєте людське обличчя, збираєте докази та робите висновки на основі цих доказів. 
Оцінка - 8.5/10

[h2]English[/h2]
L.A. Noire is one of the few games that forces the player to analyze rather than strategize. You study the human face, gather evidence, and draw conclusions based on that evidence. 
Rating - 8.5/10

185615620.review:
Recommend for those who likes detective novels/films or those who likes/understand LA stories around WWII. 

Music, story and a lot of Easter egg details with reference to historically famous cases are fantastic. 

It does have a slow pace comparing to other Rockstar games LOL (except for RDR series) so you need to be patient to figure out the logic. 

Side missions are a bit boring for me after a certain point, it is fun at first place before you experience all types of side missions.

185611493.review: Best Game I've ever played besides New Vegas

185610155.review:
While playing this game, I ended up spending an inordinate amount of time driving around in LA. I had been anticipating a plot with intricate mystery - solving style of Agatha Christie. You know, the kind where every clue is a breadcrumb leading to an unexpected revelation. Instead, what I got was more of a laid - back, style of police procedural drama ,
Undoubtedly, this game is an impressively detailed LAPD simulator. The attention to detail in recreating the 1940 LA is truly remarkable. However, what I'm really craving is a full - fledged, true detective - style experience. I want to be on the trail of a menacing serial killer. It is just not for me,

185609616.review: Absolute classic, great gameplay, which holds up for its age, and an incredible Rockstar story not worth missing, especially if you can pick it up on sale.

185576335.review: One of my favorite games of all time . Search for clues, interrogating suspects and witnesses, solving crimes. Trying to figure out if someone is lying based on facial expressions and body language. Even possibly putting the wrong person in jail. It really was a refreshing change from your typical games .

Fora isso, um excelente jogo de lógica e investigação com uma historia interessante, e que definitivamente merece as avaliações extremamente positivas que tem.

185523909.review: Clásico. Hoy por hoy se siente medio limitado pero lo veo entendible para un juego lineal de esa época. Te obliga a estar concentrado en muchos momentos, no es un juego para jugar mientras ves un gameplay de subway surfer en otra pantalla.

185501399.review: This is a criminally underappreciated game. Now, I'm not a particular fan of Rockstar games, I've never enjoyed GTA and Red Dead never held any interest for me... But a detective game, where you actually have to investigate, look for clues, question witnesses and suspects? Now THAT is my jam! and there aren't nearly enough games like it. You might get an occasional mission like that in some other game, but a whole game based around that premise? VERY rare. It's such a shame this game doesn't get the recognition it deserves and a real shame there was no sequel or follow up to it either. The stories are good, the graphics, at the time, were ground-breaking, although occasionally unintentionally hilarious. This is an absolutely brilliant game and I really wish there were more games like this... The driving sucks though...

185478898.review: Historia impresionante al nivel de Rockstars. No alcanza la jugabilidad ni los gráficos de GTA, pero el guión engancha y las misiones son bastante entretenidas.

185373177.review: An interesting game. Unique in its gameplay—I’ve never seen a game with such unusually detailed faces. The story is slightly above average, but otherwise, the game is very repetitive, even though it can be completed in about 20 hours (even less without DLCs). However, the environment is excellent, and the characters are entertaining—except for the most important one, the main character. I don’t think I’ve ever encountered a worse-written character. Perhaps if they’d focused on the story earlier instead of in the last 80% of the game, it would’ve been better. When the game is on sale, I can’t help but recommend it. A hidden gem from Rockstar. 7/10

185314508.review:
Tercera vez que lo termino y ni siquiera pude obtener todas las pistas o resolver eficientemente todos los casos. Esto habla de un juego que no solo es una joya a nivel de jugabilidad, sino que destaco también la ambientación y las mecánicas como uno de los puntos claves para que lo haya re-jugado tantas veces.

 Es una pena que haya sido uno de los juegos que más ha pasado desapercibido en toda la franquicia porque tiene potencial para enamorar al fanático de Rockstar, pero supongo que la poca prensa y la primicia de detectives en los años 40's tiró atrás a muchos. Si este es tu caso, te recomiendo al 100% darle una oportunidad, no te vas a arrepentir.

185050305.review: One of the best stories to ever be told in a video game. Replaying this game as a more patient adult was the right decision. You will chase and circle the truth, and never catch it until the end. Don't expect a straightforward logical conclusion to every case. Enjoy the unique design decisions and omissions of the gameplay and writing that create a memorable experience.

185014017.review:
L.A. Noire est un jeu au concept assez inédit. Vous êtes un inspecteur dans le Los Angeles de 1947 et vous devez mener à bien diverses enquêtes. Ce qui fait la différence avec la plupart des jeux de ce type, c'est qu'ici, c'est à vous de trouver les indices, de mener les interrogatoires et de déterminer qui ment ou qui dit la vérité. Vous devez pour cela détecter les contradictions dans les discours des suspects ou essayer de repérer certains tics nerveux pouvant être révélateurs de mensonges.
Chaque enquête est indépendante (même s'il y aura un fil rouge), il y a différentes façons de les mener, et vous pouvez réussir à découvrir la vérité, mais aussi échouer, voire emprisonner la mauvaise personne. Cela n'empêche pas de faire avancer l'histoire et donne un côté roleplay ainsi qu'une rejouabilité (il est d'ailleurs possible de refaire une enquête spécifique sans refaire tout le scénario).
L'ambiance "film noir" fonctionne très bien, et le scénario est une réussite. J'ai beaucoup aimé refaire certaines enquêtes en essayant d'autres possibilités.
Petit bémol : la sauvegarde sur le cloud de Steam n'a pas été implémentée. C'est bien dommage, mais c'est aussi le seul point négatif que je retiendrai.

185012730.review:
[h1] THEY DON'T MAKE THEM LIKE THIS ANYMORE! [/h1]

It feels like I am watching a detective/mystery TV show which I am a huge fan of! It had me hooked from start to finish. The slow build-up is absolutely worth it, and while I won't spoil the story, I can say it's very well written! 10/10 for most of the chapters. And not to forget, the facial animations in this game is mindblowingly good and detailed! Also exploring 1940s Los Angeles is a truly a delight.

L.A. Noire is truly one of its kind. It's a real shame there isn't other game out there that scratches this exact itch. If you're a fan of detective and mystery stories, this is a must-play.

184976706.review:
Das Spiel ist etwas zu halbgar als dass ich es empfehlen könnte.
Die Story hat Macken und das Ende ist ebenfalls enttäuschend.
Die Welt ist riesig aber eigentlich leer, für 100% muss man sehr nervige Dinge sammeln.

Insgesamt sollte man es nur in Maßen genießen

184951470.review: Best detective game ever created by the human! Damn, Phelps, move your butt ober here!

184926620.review: This game really makes you feel like a professional detective of the LAPD. To be honest, this game can be repetitive sometimes, but addictive at the same time due to a great storyline behind Cole Phelps. You really have to take your time and assimilate the cases properly and find all the clues to find out the real guilty. What make me really love this game is the 40s atmosphere, on the post-war period, and of course see LA and Hollywood recreated on these period, with the old cars, interesting places, clothing, lifestyle... The face MotionScan is something unbelievable for a game made in 2011, so original and novel, the facial expressions just seems like real people that you can understand only seeing his facial movements. Love that LA Noire mention the atrocious murders of Elizabeth Short and Jeanne French (Celine Henry in-game) by probably the mysterious Werewolf, besides you can do two cases about these murders and investigate them.

184905235.review: trying be the best detective i can man :{}

184889820.review:
The first 60% of the game is 6.5/10. Some open world problems, case issues, but largely a fun and engaging experience.

The last 40% of the game is -2/10. Whomever wrote the closing arcs completely destroyed the narrative and characters. Riddled with bugs and horrendous excuses for case questions. 50% of the time I'm choosing between Truth, Doubt, or Lie, I'm literally unsure of what the question was, because the two characters had 4 more lines of dialogue between the prompt and having to produce evidence. Sometimes the entire framing of the question will change in these couple of lines, leading to an entirely different dialogue path. Basic example: 

"I think you were at the place. LIAR!"
"You can't prove that I stole the monkey!"
"Of course I can, it was orange!"
"But I'm not orange, so how can that be?"

Me: .... What the fuck am I even asking this guy? Am I still asking about him being at the location, or whether he stole the monkey? What the heck are they on about with the color orange??? 

> Looks at super long evidence list with no clue whatsoever.
> Backs out of accusation and hits "doubt" because that 50/50 is better than trying to pick a piece of evidence for a question I don't understand.

And, again, they totally ruined the characters for absolutely no reason. You know how bad writers think it's fun to include stupid interpersonal conflict as a means to create tension? Yeah. That guy drank like 10 energy drinks and then got to work slashing as hard as he could. 

Real shame, wanted to love it, but it's just bad. Final: 1/10.  Skip it.

184813562.review: just as good as i remember. now in higher quality really all there is to it. top 3 Rockstar title (IMO)

184803412.review: If you guys got Crashes, just restart the mission from the beginning & windowed. its work wonder on me!

184801068.review: This game doesn't get enough love. This is an adult game. Not necessarily because of the content, but just in terms of it's design. This is not a run and gun cop game. This is not Grand Theft Auto. You will be walking around, talking to people, looking for clues, harassing suspects, and OCCASIONALLY chasing down perps and getting into cool gunfights. But really this game is about the story and the characters. You will spend a lot of time looking at peoples faces while they make funny and completely exaggerated expressions. This is what through me off the most, as most of my interrogations went south as I couldn't tell if they were lying or if they had just half of their face injected with back alley Botox. Nah, I'm just kidding. This game is exceptional and was one of the first to spend the money on facial tracking, which resulted in a game that looks much better animation wise than anything that came out at that time, and is better than many games that come out today. Also, the city is like a 1 to 1 recreation of LA at that time, so that's cool.

184799153.review: Algunas caras son graciosas, pero el juego es bueno. Hay misiones complicadas, eso ayuda a mantener el interés.

One of the best detective game i've ever played. Very nice gameplay, you can go around, gather information, do the dectective's job as in real life. And its has many well-written cases.

184783887.review: Didn’t like the gameplay very much and the LA Detective trope felt tired.

184779738.review:
I am unable to play LA Noire or any rockstar game for that manner because of a decision Rockstar made with their 3rd party platform, Rockstar Social.  Around June 2023, Rockstar made 2FA a requirement to log into Rockstar Social.  Players have Rockstar Social account setup 16 years ago when GTAIV was released on PC.  Those accounts used email addresses that have been since shutdown. I am one of those people with Verizon shutting down their email servers in 2017.

Rockstar has also slashed their support team.  There is no longer the possible to have a live chat with a support team member. Instead your email will get read by a random person every time, they will ask insanely specific and robotic questions like when was the exact date the Rockstar Social Account was made. When was it linked to steam? There are no records for these events to possibly give them the right answer. The team members aren’t even coordinated because one of them stated that they don’t expect exact dates for these questions. Yet the next question they asked, they wanted exact dates. For now, Rockstar Social has closed my tickets without recovering the account back to me stating the issue was “solved” 

Their text prompt questions couldn't even handle that RDR2 and GTAV were both gifts, and asked more than once to send them receipts of the game from the credit card company in my own personal email inbox even after showing them they were gifts.  I was able to get the original credit card numbers from my friends and family, but that wasn’t my email address.

I can’t recommend buying a Rockstar game right now if they can’t even offer a proper support team for their accounts.  It's absolutely tragic because I want to play RDR1 on PC, but won’t spend a dime until I get my account back.

184639150.review:
LA Noire is an underrated little gem by Rockstar that I enjoyed very much. I don't usually write reviews but I felt this game is very deserving of one. Here are some of my observations.

+ This game has the best voice acting of any game I have ever played. Note that I said "the best" and not "one of the best". This is subjective of course, but I think Rockstar really did a tremendous job here. 
+ very real and relatable characters, not the overexaggerated Trevor Philips type from GTA 5. The main character has a background story that unfolds throughout the game. He is not a superman of any sort which makes him very relatable. 
+ The mission design is very enjoyable and the cases have been crafted with lots of love to detail. Every case feels different and is a new challenge. Similar to GTA there are some quick missions, side missions as well as the main campaign, so mission time varies, which I love. 
+ The game has a beautiful post WW2 atmosphere. Characters, buildings, streets, car radio music, some old-fashioned use of language and expressions, all of that contributes to the 1940s feeling.
+ The cases have on occasion be challenging for me because my short-term memory is pretty bad and I have trouble remembering names and associating names with faces and events. For every case, new characters are introduced, and I have sometimes found in tricky to follow the plot. But I have the same issues when watching movies or TV shows. and this game is a fun way to challenge myself to focus on a case and try to understand what's going on. I guess that's real detective work anyway after all, so it adds to the immersion for me. 

Even though it has been quite a few years after its release, this game is still very enjoyable and well worth the money, especially when on sale. 

It should be noted that the frame rates are limited to 30 FPS by default which may not result in a pleasant gaming experience for everyone. However, there are patches out there that unlock the frame rate, thus resulting in much more fluid gameplay. These patches are easy to install and strongly recommended.

184613755.review:
I just beat L.A. Noire, which is apparently impressive because the achievement for beating the game has about a 10% completion rate. That's my credibility here.

So do I recommend this game? No. There are better detective games out there, better third person shooters, and games with much better stories. Plus, there's a lot of stuff to talk about external to the game that I want to lay out here, about the developers of the game, and the publisher.

But I'll talk about the game first.

L.A. Noire is a third person game where you walk around and interact with stuff in the environment. Doing so usually adds a clue to your collection. Actually making progress generally involves then taking your assembled clues and interviewing a 'person of interest'.

Here's where the problems start.

L.A. Noire uses a technology known as 'MotionScan' to capture basically 3D video of people's faces so they can put them into the game. Now, this might sound pretty cool, but if you ever boot this game up today you will find pretty quickly that this was a pretty limited technology. It only works at 30fps so the game is locked to that framerate, and while the effect works somewhat well on some of the more prominent main characters, you will notice that it rapidly becomes almost horrifying when you see some of the faces on some side characters. Evidence of cut corners and rushed production.

I have a feeling there was another limitation, where, no one could ever have their hair down, because EVERY single character in this game wears their hair as short as is possible, and it becomes extremely noticeable when you see that every single female character in particular, is wearing their hair in a bun as tight and close to their scalp as possible. If you look at the box art for L.A. Noire you will notice there's a blonde woman wearing her hair down, and if you don't know anything about the game you probably think oh, she's some sort of femme fatale, a typical character type for a 'noir' game. 

Except that character is not found anywhere in this game. She's not a character, she's just on the box art. Anyway, let me get back to the gameplay here, because it ties in with MotionScan.

When doing an interview, which as mentioned is how you progress in this game, you get 3 options after asking a question: Truth, Doubt or Lie. Now, the game does a terrible job of explaining what these are but basically it means you have the option of essentially asking them to continue speaking, via Truth - which accepts their statement to get a calm reasonable explanation from them - or you pick Doubt, to Doubt their statement and to play the conversation harder, usually threatening them for information. 'Lie' means you call them out as a liar because you have hard evidence.

Oh, also you only get ONE shot by the way. You get ONE CHANCE to pick correctly, if you fail, that question is removed and marked with an X because you failed and you are forced to move on.

The problem is... you can sort of intuit which option you're meant to select, but because there are two 'call them out on their lies' options (Doubt & Lie), you often face a dilemma where, you KNOW they are hiding something but you're not sure which way to approach it. This, finally is where MotionScan comes in - the idea was, and the conceit of the game, is that you yourself are meant to look at their face and just intuit what's behind their expression. 

However, it is ONLY useful if they lie really effectively. Almost no one lies effectively in this game, and when they do they always make a bizarrely overacted facial expression to show you they are hiding something.

There's other problems.

So for example if you say "Where were you last night?" and then they say "I was at home, sir" then make a shifty face, you might have both evidence they were NOT at home, while also being able to intuit it from their expression. So which do you pick? Doubt, or Lie? I should note here, to be clear, that this game only wants 1 answer. Sometimes even if you have evidence to catch them out, selecting Lie simply won't work - you have to pick Doubt. And the opposite is also true - if the game wants you to select Lie, then you usually can't use Doubt. It just won't work.

This puts you in situations where, you KNOW the guy is hiding something but you don't know which option to pick. So what do you do? There's nothing for it but to look up a walkthrough - or do what I did which was very tedious, which is run through the conversation, fail, then restart from checkpoint and try again over and over until I got it right.

This for me was one of the big things that completely killed most of the enjoyment of the game, because L.A. Noire, interestingly, is a game where it doesn't really care if you complete the case rightly or not. So you can progress through the game, while basically failing most things in the case. Failing however, means you often just don't get to solve the mystery, and that sucks.

The writing in general for L.A. Noire is what I would describe as amateurish. The 'writer and director' and I put that in quotes, is credited as Brendan McNamara. I don't know how much influence he actually had, but I would love to pin this story on him because it's honestly terrible. And once again - amateurish. This game, L.A. Noire, was released in 2011, and yet it has seemingly a child's understanding of a lot of things, in particular World War II.

There's two Rockstar writers credited, veterans who worked on most of the GTA games and then would go on to work on GTA V. If any of the writing in this game stands up to scrutiny, I would say it's the dialogue, and both of these guys are credited very specifically as 'dialogue writers'. Michael Unsworth and Rupert Humphries.

Now that I've talked about my main issues with the gameplay, I can get into the background stuff, it's almost more interesting than the game itself - which as I have basically said, is not very good.

Team Bondi who were the main dev team on L.A. Noire bit off way more than they could chew, Rockstar who was publishing for them came in and brought devs to bail them out, and then gradually took more and more creative control over from the Team Bondi guys, who were a lot of kids hired out of university. Some were put into made-up job positions such as 'Junior Level Designer' but all were paid terrible salaries such as 35k-45k AUD a year.

Employees worked 70 hour work weeks late in development, from 9AM to 7PM Monday to Saturday and even Sundays too. No one wanted to animate for Team Bondi so they had no lead animator for most of development. When the game came out, over 30 staff were owed a combined total of $1 million AUD in unpaid wages - which lines up with the fact that some people were not being paid upfront, but at the end of the project supposedly in exchange for working particular hours. There was ramping crunch from 2007-2011.

Team Bondi had high turnover rates and there are many disgruntled employees who have testified that the infamous 'writer and director' above Brendan McNamara is kind of not a nice guy. There's another name that comes up frequently, Vicky Lord, who sounds like a fountain of BS. Everyone working on the game for the last two years or maybe more of development, were told in emails that the game is 'just around the corner' and 'very near to being complete' so everyone just needed to crunch a little bit harder.

None of these stories really should be remotely surprising if you keep up with similar stories in the news from the past few years of gamedevs being paid too little to do too much work. But I found it enlightening to read up on it. 

Team Bondi is gone. I don't know who gets paid when you buy this. So don't.

L.A. Noire is a hollow shell of a game with an unsatisfying story.

183949952.review:
This game was pretty fun. I enjoyed uncovering the greater mystery at the end of every desk and the overarching story finishes up in a relatively interesting way. Picking up all the newspapers gives a lot of context for the main story. Each case takes about an hour and there's 26 cases divided across 5 desks (the types of crimes you're solving). There's also 40 short street crimes that take a few minutes which pop up from time to time.  

The truth/doubt/lie system is a little clunky, but you get used to it after the first few cases. The faces of the people when you're interviewing them are pure comedy, best part of the game. Driving around feels good, but you can really speed up the game a lot by having your partner drive. It really rewards you for uncovering all the clues in each crime scene. Can't really speak to the graphics quality or the accuracy of the 1947 Los Angeles it portrays since I'm playing it 13 years after it came out. It looks like an old game, and the dialogue definitely matches the times. I found it all pretty easy to look past.

If it's over 50% off, you enjoy the puzzle/mystery genre and/or you like other games by Rockstar, I'd say it's worth a picking up and playing through. The achievements are a bit of a grind though, don't think I'll be coming back to 100% it.

183932014.review: De los mejores videojuegos que he jugado jamás, una obra de arte con todas sus letras, gracias Rockstar por hacerlo todo y que la gente no lo valore suficiente...

183919815.review:
L.A. Noire, the game that deserves sequel more than GTA and Red Dead series.

Story: 10/10
Very well written story, with very well written characters, perfectly representing late 1940's Los Angeles, politics, police, Hollywood and crime.

Cutscenes: 20/10
Face Capture Technology used in this game is probably still of one the best in gaming industry, helping you really immerse yourself into the story, every conversation is unique with different emotions shown from each character.

Gameplay: 9/10
Overall gameplay is very good, you have all needed mechanics for this type of game to fully enjoy it, everything works without issues.
Shooting Mechanics are perfect for this kind of game, cover system offers just enough, guns feel different and realistic enough.
Driving Mechanics are not the best, I mean, they work, but vehicle steering feels meh, though it can be pretty fun once you get used to them.

Sounds: 10/10 
Everything is well balanced and sound properly

World: 100/10
All of us know how game worlds from Rockstar are detailed, but when it comes to L.A. Noire map, its even more detailed than any GTA or Red Dead game currently available.
For a game that does not focus much on a free-roam aspect, the map is amazingly detailed with so much enterable buildings, rooftops to climb on, stairs to take, tunnels to explore....etc... so much stuff that 95% of the players will easily miss, without even knowing they exist.
I am still blown away how well made this map is.

L.A. Noire is highly recommended game fi you like Action-Adventure games, especially if you are a fan of Detective games, then this game is perfect for you!

183898817.review:
L.A Noire e um jogo policial de investigação, o jogo se passa nos anos 50, logo apos o termino da WW2. O protagonista e Detetive Phelps um veterano Tenente do USMC, condecorado com herói de guerra, o qual agora trabalha da LAPD. A trama do jogo se envolve em resolver casos como homicídios, narcóticos, roubo a veículos e o combate a corrupção dentro da própria policia e governo.

O jogo tem uma historia incrível, e o que da mais profundidade e saber que diversos casos relatados durante o jogo, são baseados (alguns sao praticamente iguais) em casos reais, o que deixa um peso ainda maior na narrativa do jogo (O vídeo no Youtube: “How Historically Accurate is L.A. Noire?” mostra isso em detalhes).

Porem tenho que assumir que a versão de PC veio com vários problemas, o primeiro e o preço, acho que esta sendo cobrado muito caro em preço cheio, mas em promoção comprei por menos de 30 reais. Segundo e a otimização, percebe-se que foi um Port muito mal feito, pois o jogo e capado a 30 FPS e os controles não são dos melhores, mas nada que justifique não jogar. Outra coisa que não gostei, achei que foi muito pouco desenvolvida foi em relação a "Traição do Phelps", mas não quero comentar muito por conta de spoilers...

Em resumo recomendo bastante para quem gosta do gênero, mesmo com seus problemas acredito ainda ser um dos melhores títulos da Rockstar. Se você gosta de uma boa trama e uma gameplay mais devagar com resolução de enigmas, esse jogo é obrigatório!

183894142.review: Пройшов ще один шедевр від Rockstar Games. Сюжет та атмосфера просто неймовірні у грі.  Із мінусів можна виділити те, що не можна пропустити заставки, але на фоні такої гри це пустяки. 9/10.

Its a must play for everyone. You won't be able to find a similar experience elsewhere.

183791674.review:
Багато років тому я з нетерпінням чекав релізу цієї гри. Рекламували її з обіцянками небаченого раніше сканування міміки облич, та ще й у моєму улюбленому жанрі - детективі.

Довга шестирічна розробка викликала скепсис тоді у всіх, але я вірив в неї та купив одразу після випуску порту на ПК, куди завезли кривий лаунчер, що не давав нормально запустити гру перший час. І ось недавно купив її ще раз, щоб мати у Steam під рукою. І можу сказати – це того варте. Хоч п'ять раз - все одно shut up and take my money. 

Аналогів серед ААА їй немає. Розробники прекрасно передали дух часу, місцеву корупцію, похіть і жадобу всіх навколо, а в деякий випадках - тупізм рівня homo erectus.  Хотів би стерти пам'ять, щоб заново пережити це. Не використовуйте гайди, вони тільки псують враження! Саундтрек прекрасно під стать, акторська гра на висоті і є свої перли час від часу, та і можна покращити свою англійську. 

Багато різних детективів наклепали, але чогось подібного не можу згадати - тут все таки далеко не одна справа, є простір розгулятись. Однак зазначу, щоб насолодитись сповна, прийдеться трохи прикривати очі. Світ тут мертвий і більше нагадує декорацію, - що досить поетично, якщо подумати про місто подій і чим воно славиться. Розробникам не вдалося створити живий світ на рівні GTA, правда не думаю що він тут і потрібен. Отримати своє задоволення від історії вийде і так, благо вона тут концентрована. Головний герой теж не бездоганний, іноді приймає сумнівні рішення, але це робить його більш людяним, чи що, бо людина без пороків в Лос-Анджелесі – місті гріхів, як не як, не може існувати. І Коул Фелпс черговий тому доказ.

P.S. Стім такий політкоретний, що слово "людина" на латині теж матюк.  Дивний новий світ.

183606180.review:
I'm only about 15% done with the game so far, I'll prob update this review later on once I'll get to 100%. 

So far, this god-awful interrogation system is actual AIDS.
It literally feels like RNG gambling to choose the right option, and there is no real way to restart the interrogation, except restarting the whole case or constantly quitting back to main menu (you will likely have to collect clues all over again though). 

"Doubt" ESPECIALLY is such a shitty, unclear option. I am aware that these options were all called something else before being released on PC, but either way there is no clear way to know if you're supposed to either select a doubt or lie (& evidence). I am good at realizing if something is a lie (despite the fact that the face of whoever you're interviewing always looks just constipated and/or weird most of the time), but deciding what the absurd, specific evidence is supposed to be the "right" one also makes no real sense at times. This game is like 45% interrogations and they made this part of the gameplay such an un-enjoyable, illogical, gamble of what the right option should be.

Also, why does this require rockstar launcher? does a singleplayer game REALLY need it? lol. (I had no issues with the launcher itself though)

Maybe buy it at an astronomical discount, because there is no way this ancient game is still really worth a whole 20$.

Edit: 
I've played through a few more cases, and it's just awful, snoozefest of an experience.
The "action", especially shooting is quite boring and way too repetitive. Street Crimes are mostly un-creative "shoot goons" which tends to just throw you off the case you're doing.

The interrogation system was just as awful as it was in the first few cases. Intuition points are almost impossible to come by after like Rank 8-10, and why the fuck are they capped at 5? Either way, the only good option is the "ask the community", removing an answer is almost always useless (In my experience it would always just remove "lie", which seems to be the most rare correct out of truth or doubt anyway). 
This whole "faces tell you if they're lying or not" is also absolutely unreliable bullshit. In the "Red Lipstick Murder" Case, when you interview bar owner, on the last third question, he makes a completely neutral looking face, and his statement seemed correct, but oh no, I was apparently supposed to choose "doubt" there, yeah ok.
Another example would be "Golden Butterfly" Case when interviewing the daughter, on the second question she made a completely neutral face, her statement seemed true, but no it was also apparently doubt, yeah ok. How the fuck do you fuck up the most integral game mechanic? Nope, I'm done with dealing with this bullshit.

The achievements are boring and like 1/3 of them are just "collect 10 gorillion of this" and 95 WHOLE VEHICLES, most of which look the fucking same. 

Character/partner dialogue is almost non-existent and if you have to pay attention to the road you'll probably miss a good bit of it anyway. 

Maybe back then this game would be considered fun and "revolutionary" due to the face animations or something, but it has aged like a loaf of bread, it's quite an awful and boring experience. Can't even refund this anymore. Thank fucking god I bought it a discount. Quite an overhyped game.

Edit 2:
Completed 100%. I'll have to cut this review edit much shorter due to word limit.
After completely flopping the golden butterfly case because interrogations don't make much fucking sense, I've just been using a steam guide to double check my option before actually pressing it. Which I personally recommend you do too (unless you do not care about achievements).
- Interrogations still sucked throughout the whole game, without a guide I'd only get about slightly over half of them correct on average (so I would always only get 4 stars despite doing none or minimal damage when driving or finding over 90% of clues). The faces were still very inconsistent & unreliable, sometimes they make the most goofy blatant faces when they lie, but then they'd say some half-truth shit or something that you literally cannot verify with anything and make a completely normal neutral looking face, but no it wasn't actually a "truth" statement, which is still complete bs. I now kinda see why the intuition points are capped at 5 (because past rank 20 you just get 5 points on every case), but with how bad the system you should be allowed to use up to like 10. Another reason why this truth, doubt, and lie system is bad is because you can't actually tell what Cole himself is thinking or is going to say once you actually press those options (besides lie, which you can back out of, unlike with the latter). You either should be allowed a second chance to ask the same question OR let those options be more descriptive of what Cole is actually going to say. It also sucks how you have to rely only on the face, instead of the whole body language, like them fidgeting with hands when they lie, etc. Some evidence which should prove a lie don't apparently prove a lie, can't recall any specific examples since I stopped bothering with the system past that homicide case. 
- Bringing completely new game mechanics out of nowhere past early game, with straight up death (fail) if you don't do them right. Such as balancing on objects and especially the very weird balancing mechanic when walking on planks and such. The collapsing platforms when walking in the tar pit were also a bit annoying.
- Janky, Clunky inspection of objects (evidence), especially when inspecting (usually dead) bodies. Sometimes it asks you for a really weird hyper-specific angle which you could barely hold before it finally zooms into some detail on an object, which was a mildly annoying. 
- Speaking of evidence, those little brief descriptions of evidence you find in the notebook are quite bad, especially for any large paper documents or letters you find. There should've been an option to inspect those more closer in detail without having to constantly return to them. It sometimes felt like those little descriptions would also leave out important parts of that evidence.
- Why add 95 whole different vehicles (even though most really just look the same and have near identical stats with exception of bonus cars) with this huge of a map with so many roads, and not put garage's or something around the map to actually use those vehicles you collect? Very odd. Devs practically already have the system with the vehicle room showcase in the menu to use for that.
- Newspaper collectibles. Why would you assign so much story/lore to missable collectibles? But then make the other like 100 collectibles (landmarks, 50 fucking gold film reels, police badges) have completely no rewards or anything besides a few achievements? Also quite questionable.
- Pedestrian NPCs would sometimes just run into your car instead of evading it or VERY slowly walk across the road despite you blaring the siren. Same with the driver NPCs just spontaneously turning right into your path or stopping right in front of you (with siren on), happened a bit too many times to be ignored. Quite annoying.
- Roy's car sucks so much. Acceleration, turning, general handling, etc. is much poorer than the car of any other 3 partners you get.
- Why even add a flamethrower? You literally only get to use it to kill like 4 dudes at the worst possible scenario. It was so hilariously bad how you had to waddle with it in water while being shot at and then try to kill them in such open areas with how shitty the range of it is.
-Chasing is often so scripted even in street crimes. 

The map itself (not graphics) is good. Radio music & audio in general is great. Story is quite good (ending mid at best). Cars look good but too similar & too many.

183577194.review: O jogo tem muitos problemas, alguns são tranquilos de ignorar outros nem tanto. Destaco os vários buracos na história e principalmente falhas na gameplay ao escolher duvidar, acreditar ou contestar uma pessoa. Muitas vezes provas que servem para dizer que a pessoa está mentindo não são aceitas, ou mesmo quando fazendo caretas ela estavam dizendo verdade, ou pior, zero expressão no rosto e era pra duvidar. Pra mim estes dois pontos foram os piores porque atrapalharam na experiêcia da história, o resto dá pra ignorar. Os gráficos bugaram todas as vezes que joguei e sempre precisava configurar o jogo quando iniciava. Se você gosta do gênero e não se aborrece muito facilmente, recomendo jogar apesar de todos os problemas. Nunca vi nenhum jogo de investigação nessa pegada. Um remake bem feito cairia bem. Não vale o preço cheio.

183572873.review: Is the best police game i ever played

183570411.review: this game is fire ive started walking around in a suit and tie stroking my beard thoughtfully and going "hm... something isn't adding up here." in public and it's really boosted my confidence

183560236.review: Driving around in this game is more enjoyable than mafia 1 and 2 remastered

183550290.review: One of Rocksta's unique games, we need more games like this. It's not about the action in here, it's about analyzing every little detail like a real detective. A truly unique experience, a must play imo.

183521017.review:
Когда меня спросят почему спиратить лучше чем купить,я приведу в пример эту игру. 
Ну серьезно б#ть. Меня всегда удивлял рокстар. Иметь х#еву тучу денег,выпускать игры которые почти сходу становяться легендарными и иметь настолько у#банский лаунчер? Даже у трижды проклятого юбисофта,все не так плохо. Что же касается непосредственно игры - То я е#бал,игра не запускается на русском,ладно не проблема,решение в интернете нашлось и исправилось за 2 минуты. Следующее - лок в 30 кадров. Есть патчи,фиксы и т.д и все это от умельцев из интернета. Но читая отзывы понимаешь ,что игра начнет е#бланить как только ты уберешь лок. То есть,я в 2024 году,должен смотреть на рвущуюся картинку,лагающую (В любом случае)  игру и платить за это деньги? Причем если скачать с торрента,то никаких проблем,играй на здоровье. Ну молодцы х#ли,могете.....
